poem:
**Echoes on the Shore**

Four seals, silent  
on the Norfolk strand—  
feathers tangled,  
whisper of wings gone by.  
  
Salt and bitter tears  
blend in cold waves,  
as echoes of flight  
grounded,  
whirl between  
sea and sky—  
a fragile thread,  
unspooled.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Four seals die on Norfolk coast after contracting bird flu Experts have raised fears for the seals at England’s largest colony after four were found to have died after having been infected with bird flu. Government scientists are investigating to find out whether the seals died after scavenging from the corpses of infected birds. Four seals on the north Norfolk coast were found dead on the shoreline and tested positive for bird flu. Two of". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
